alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 09 at 3:10PM MDT until May 10 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE, AND LAL 6 ACROSS THE EAST... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEYS, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds will persist over the Northeast Highlands until early evening. Tonight, mostly poor humidity recovery is forecast there, and over central and western parts of the forecast area. Critical to extreme fire weather conditions are likely Wednesday over all zones. A very unstable airmass is expected Wednesday with isolated dry thunderstorms over the Four Corners region, and scattered to isolated dry thunderstorms from the Sangre de Cristo Mountains southeastward to around Portales and Clovis. After a Pacific cold front Wednesday night, strong northwest winds and very low humidities will return to most locations Thursday causing fire weather concerns to linger. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from noon to 8 pm MDT on Tuesday. On Wednesday from 11 am to 10 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 mph Tuesday afternoon and evening. South to southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to near 55 or 60 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent Tuesday. About 8 to 10 hours of single digit humidity is forecast Tuesday. 10 to 15 percent on Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
